---

### Short answer
- **Not right now.** That setup is for Next.js. Your `proxitheapp.com` deploys from `freestyle-october/` which is a static/gulp site, so the `<SpeedInsights />` package won’t apply.

### What’s worth doing instead (no/low effort)
- **Enable Vercel Web Analytics** for the project to get traffic + basic performance without code changes.
- **Run Lighthouse** (locally or CI) to track regressions.
- If you want real‑user Core Web Vitals on the static site, **wire up `web-vitals` → GA4/Sentry**; that works without moving to Next.js.

### When it is worth it
- If you migrate the site to **Next.js**, adding Vercel Speed Insights is a 1–2 line change and gives first‑party RUM in the Vercel dashboard with negligible overhead—then yes, do it.

- If you want, I can switch on Vercel Web Analytics now or add a `web-vitals` snippet to `freestyle-october/index.html`.
